name: L'Annee Occultiste et Psychique (IAPSOP)
content:
L'Annee Occultiste et Psychique (IAPSOP) About Archives Practices Contribute Contacts Search     Periodical: L'Annee Occultiste et Psychique Summary:  From Pat Deveney's database: Annee Occultiste et Psychique, L'. Ou expose annuel des observations scientifiques et des travaux publies en France et à l'Etranger dans les sciences mysterieuses Astrologie, Alchimie, Symbolique, Esoterisme, arts divinatoires, Prophetique, psychisme, spiritisme, Magnetisme. 1908--1909 Paris, France. Language: French. Publisher: Henri Daragon. Editor: Pierre Piobb (Pierre Vincenti Comte da Piobetta). 1/1, 1908 (for the year 1907)-1909 (for 1908). "Piobb" (Comte Pierre Vincenti, 1874-1942) was a Corsican journalist and a well-respected astrologer, magician and occultist. He wrote on, among other things, Les Mysteres des Dieux: Venus, la Deesse Magique de la Chair, and a book on the secret of Nostradamus. This journal was to be an annual retrospective on things occult, and included articles by most of the leading occultists of the period: Piobb, Oswald Wirth, Ch. M. Limousin, Papus, Alta, Annie Besant, Teder, Ernest Bosc, Ch. Lancelin, Paul Vulliaud, Jollivet-Castelot, C. Flammarion, "Jules Bois" (Henri Antoine Jules-Bois), and H. Durville, and many others. The journal gave a full account (from Le Voile d'Isis) of the Spiritualist Congress held in Paris in 1907. Apparently only two volumes were issued. LOC; BNF; ZDB: Freiburg Inst Grenzgeb Psychol; Berlin SBB Haus Potsdamer Str; Center for Research Libraries, Illinois; University of Wisconsin, Madison. Issues:L'Annee Occultiste et Psychique 1907 L'Annee Occultiste et Psychique 1908
